passages.text: The Tao that can be told is not the eternal Tao. The name that can be named is not the eternal name.
passages.context: The opening paradox: the ultimate cannot be captured in words. Language points but cannot contain.

passages.text: When people see some things as beautiful, other things become ugly. When people see some things as good, other things become bad.
passages.context: Judgment creates its opposite. The moment you distinguish, you divide.

passages.text: The supreme good is like water, which nourishes all things without trying to. It is content with the low places that people disdain.
passages.context: Water as model: it serves without striving, seeks the lowest place, and in that finds its power.

passages.text: In the pursuit of learning, every day something is acquired. In the pursuit of Tao, every day something is dropped.
passages.context: Knowledge adds; wisdom subtracts. The path to Tao is letting go, not gathering.

passages.text: He who knows does not speak. He who speaks does not know.
passages.context: True knowing brings silence. The one who understands has little to say.

passages.text: A journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step.
passages.context: The vast is approached through the small. Every great accomplishment has a humble start.

passages.text: The soft overcomes the hard. The slow overcomes the fast. Let your workings remain a mystery. Just show people the results.
passages.context: Gentleness wins. Don't advertise your methods — just let the work speak.

passages.text: To know that you do not know is the best. To think you know when you do not is a disease.
passages.context: Awareness of ignorance is wisdom. False certainty is illness.

passages.text: Nature does not hurry, yet everything is accomplished.
passages.context: Natural timing achieves without rushing. Urgency is human; completion is natural.

passages.text: When I let go of what I am, I become what I might be.
passages.context: Clinging to current identity blocks future possibility. Release enables transformation.

passages.text: The Tao is like a well: used but never used up. It is like the eternal void: filled with infinite possibilities.
passages.context: The source doesn't deplete. Empty, it contains all potential.

passages.text: Do you have the patience to wait till your mud settles and the water is clear? Can you remain unmoving till the right action arises by itself?
passages.context: Wu-wei in practice: don't force clarity. Wait for the mud to settle; right action will emerge.

passages.text: The Master does nothing, yet he leaves nothing undone.
passages.context: The paradox of wu-wei: not-doing accomplishes everything. Effortless action.

passages.text: Care about what other people think and you will always be their prisoner.
passages.context: External validation is bondage. Freedom begins when you stop needing approval.

passages.text: Those who know do not predict. Those who predict do not know.
passages.context: True understanding doesn't claim to know the future. Prediction is often pretension.

passages.text: The flame that burns twice as bright burns half as long.
passages.context: Intensity costs. What blazes brilliantly doesn't last. Sustainable beats spectacular.

passages.text: Simplicity, patience, compassion. These three are your greatest treasures.
passages.context: The three jewels. Not complexity, not speed, not indifference — but their opposites.

passages.text: If you realize that all things change, there is nothing you will try to hold on to.
passages.context: Grasping comes from forgetting impermanence. Remember that everything changes, and release becomes natural.

passages.text: Knowing others is intelligence; knowing yourself is true wisdom. Mastering others is strength; mastering yourself is true power.
passages.context: External mastery impresses. Self-mastery transforms. The harder conquest is within.

passages.text: Be content with what you have; rejoice in the way things are. When you realize there is nothing lacking, the whole world belongs to you.
passages.context: Lack is perception. When you see you have enough, you have everything.
